result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob W Gessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob W Gessler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob W Gessler was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Warrant was served prior to cancelation. Reinstated signature bond sent to DCJ to release defendant regarding this case.

- Defendant shall cooperate and follow all rules of the Dane County Drug Court Diversion Program.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 2:31
Defendant in court with Attorney Patrick Schilling.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Drug Diversion Program. Drug Court Diversion Contract signed.  Bail continued.
